laboratory_examinations.findings: High serum TSH; FT4 was greater than 6.0 ng/dl (normal range, 0.7–1.9 mU/liter); FT3 was greater than 30 pg/ml (normal range, 1.8–4.2 mU/liter); TSH was 14.4 mU/liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 1 month of age, brainstem-evoked response audiometry showed mild to moderate hearing loss; further TFT suggestive of RTH; increasing goiter size and presence of macronodules leading to thyroidecomy at 8.75 yr of age.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Subject IV-1 had mildly elevated serum TSH, with FT4 and FT3 levels within normal range.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Father had elevated TSH at 28 years despite FT4I above upper limit of normal; the mother had high serum total T4 and FT4 concentrations.
